meanings.definition: Offering nothing that is stimulating or challenging.
meanings.sent1: The movie was so vapid that I fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent2: Her vapid expression showed she was not interested in the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The vapid lecture on paint drying was surprisingly popular with the insomniac group.
meanings.sent4: The vapid landscape stretched out before us, devoid of any excitement.
meanings.sent5: The vapid book left me yearning for a story with more depth.

meanings.sent1: The party was vapid, with no music or dancing to liven things up.
meanings.sent2: His vapid performance on stage failed to captivate the audience.
meanings.sent3: The vapid cat slept through the entire noisy party, undisturbed.
meanings.sent4: The vapid sky hung heavy with gray clouds, matching my mood.
meanings.sent5: The vapid conversation at the dinner table made me wish for more engaging company.
